body:
Bumps [async-trait](https://github.com/dtolnay/async-trait) from 0.1.61 to 0.1.63.
Release notes

Sourced from async-trait's releases.

0.1.62

  • Improve error message involving elided lifetimes (#229)
Commits
  • 36bcff4 Release 0.1.63
  • f88c287 Merge pull request #235 from dtolnay/patterns
  • 1c2e90a Make expansion of nested _ and .. patterns edition independent
  • 80a9c2c Add regression test for issue 234
  • 125917f Merge pull request #233 from dtolnay/reference
  • ba93025 Bypass Sync bound implied by non-existent drop of reference
  • 70bf4b0 Add regression test for issue 232
  • d71c74d Release 0.1.62
  • 861b6bc Merge pull request #230 from dtolnay/definedhere
  • b4c19da Improve spans of named lifetimes generated from elided lifetimes
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Fix: Remove read

This read was a bug. We only need to read two bytes and then decide what to do, not three.

Adds error contexts and logging to behaviour test implementations.

Extracted from #133.

This patchset fixes the behaviour test execution to be concurrent.

Extracted from #133.

This is necessary to keep the default-behaviour of the executable if no commands are passed.

This is extracted from #133 for making that PR smaller.

Adds logging output via tracing in the tester implementation.

This is extracted from #133 for making that PR smaller.
